level.heading: EXPIRATION OF SPECIAL EXCEPTION USES (ยง 11-3132)

level.text: If a special exception use is established, the use will only expire if:
An expiration date is specified in the order;
The special exception use is discontinued for any reason for any period of three (3) or more years occurring after October 8, 2010; except where governmental action impedes access to the premises; or
A certificate of occupancy for a different use is issued after October 8, 2010.
If a special exception use expires, any subsequent use shall conform to the regulations of the district in which the use is located.

Notwithstanding ยง 3132.1(b), a special exception use shall not expire if there is objective proof of a continuing use or of affirmative steps taken to resume the use during the period of time identified by the Zoning Administrator when revoking an existing certificate of occupancy or denying an application for a replacement certificate of occupancy.
